post: Good excuse to go through customs when carrying an engagement ring

comment.body:
It seems that you can declare it online and no need to go through customs at the airport

On the government's website

[https://www.gov.uk/bringing-goods-into-uk-personal-use/when-to-declare-goods](https://www.gov.uk/bringing-goods-into-uk-personal-use/when-to-declare-goods)

it says "You can [declare goods online](https://www.gov.uk/bringing-goods-into-uk-personal-use/declaring-goods) from 5 days (120 hours) before you’re due to arrive in the UK.

You can calculate and pay any tax and duty you owe when you declare your goods. The customs and excise duty you pay online are calculated [using simplified rates](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/simplified-rates-for-bringing-personal-goods-into-the-uk)."

Not trying to encourage you to break the law (kinda)…. But I would just put it in amongst your personal items in your hand luggage and if they even notice it on the Xray, they would likely just assume it is your pre existing ring?? How would they know if it was brand new? I would just really carefully check your other belongings to do the best you can to avoid them having to open your case (eg I got searched recently because my toothpaste tube was too big 😞).

ETA: loads of people travel with engagement rings for planned proposals, I assume they just stick them in their bag and call it good??
Don't keep the receipt. If anyone asks (they won't) you bought the ring in the UK but never found the right time to propose while on the trip.
Just walk through…
You could propose while you’re on holidays. Then your fiancee can wear the ring!
If you get caught, just get on one knee right away.  Tell them that you bought the ring in RSA because you wanted it to remind them of this trip. That would make a great story.

Well, one time I smuggled "the one ring" to middle earth, but customs almost ended the adventure.

A few years back, my fiance, me and two of our friends made plans to travel new zealand. Since both of our friends were traveling the world, it was a nice idea to reunite at the world's end (from our point of living).
My friend had the idea to propose, so he ordered the ring online and sent it to my place, and asked me to bring it to new zealand. When we entered, I headed to customs and they asked for the rings origin and if I planned to take it back with me. Since that was my intention (cause my friends soon-to-be-fiance would keep it), they told me, I would have to pay taxes.
I told them the hole story and the both custom lady's were visibly delighted...and let me go.

I wasn't even thinking a second about just wearing that damned ring and wear it "as my own", which would have been way smarter.

This isn’t anything you need to worry about. The value of my fiancées ring was high and I just put it in my hand luggage inside a shoe. I could see the guy see the ring, but he let it pass because he knew what’s up.
I love that you want to be honest and just do a nice thing for your soon to be fiancee, and everyone here is instead giving you tips how to break the law lol

I am also a coin collectir, and when I visited Venice last month I bought a Venetian gold coin for 1050 €. I have no idea if I should've declared it through customs or not, I just put the small package in my wallet and had no problem going through security or anything. 🤷‍♂️


For the one who's interested, the coins I bought was a 1 Zecchino – Alvise Contarini, 1676-1684.
Just put the ring in your toiletries and get rid of the box that may make it look purchased and then buy a new box at home
Is proposing in South Africa not an option?

To avoid the tax you could wear it as they won't question that. 

I find it you're honest with border force they can be more forgiving. 

I brought cigarettes to Singapore where they make you pay tax on any amount. I declared I had some and I think the officer couldn't be bothered with the paper work and waved me through!
I saw you got other answers but seeds and plants.

I had to go through customs because we bought sausage from a market and it was not in sealed packaging. 

I'm in a database now for attempted sausage smuggling.

I wasn't trying to smuggle it, we figured it was innocuous that it was not a big deal but we were wrong. They just threw the sausage away and sent us on our way.
Wear it and be done with it!
Just put it in your pocket and walk through.
Buy some snacks. You're supposed to declare all food and they'll quickly wave you through when it's just prepackaged stuff.

When’s the last time your hand luggage was x-rayed when arriving into a UK airport? It just doesn’t happen.

Keep it in your hand luggage and walk through the nothing to declare lane.
I am would just put it on my key ring. Drop it in the little box with shoes, belt and laptop. Walk through scanner and pick up stuff on other side. Not even gonna mention it.
Take an old ring box with you. Put new ring inside. Pretend you have owned new ring for many years. You have nothing to declare. Just act casual.
Wear it, turn the stone around.  Toss the box and buy a nicer one in the states.
This is the right answer, OP!  If you do this you can go through the "nothing to declare" line.

Oh, that online declaration is a perfect solution. The web site even says you can use the "nothing to declare" line after filling out the form.

That's much less fun (but legally safer) than what I was going to suggest of slipping a note to customs agent:

> I need to declare this ring. Can you take me aside to send me to the customs line for the declaration because I intend to use it as an engagement ring to propose to my girlfriend? Can you act like I've been selected for secondary inspection and forbid her from coming along?

I brought a ring from NJ to Hawaii in my carry on mostly because I didn’t want it out of my possession. Never heard a peep about it from security. Didn’t go through customs though. 

I would just not declare it but I’m probably a little bit more on the risky side. Seeing that you can pay in advance online is a pretty good idea too. I’d probably just do that if it’s not overly complicated and prohibitive. I assume it’s not a crazy fee.
Nah, if anyone asks tell them she said "no". Sympathy points.
Maybe the ring is for someone else…
You could even post the receipt home
The partner isn’t aware they’ll be proposed to so if they see it on OPs finger I think the surprise might be ruined.
Abe Froman?
Do you think the security line is customs?
He’s from the UK..  you realize Reddit is worldwide and not just in the states ?
"passport control agent" won't take you anywhere. Their job is to check your travel documents. Normally they work far away from customs, which is after baggage reclaim area.

Ahh yes, let’s hand paper like in a robbery scenario. That would probably go well in a airport post 9/11 

All seriousness I personally would not hand a note to anyone who is on any type of guardian although I might be a little boring in that aspect.
There is no customs between NJ and Hawaii, only USDA inspection

My brother NJ and Hawaii belong to the same country (USA) while customs are a thing for traveling between countries since you have to pay taxes for expensive goods you buy in a foreign country and bring back to your home country
Shhhhh....👀👀👀 But yes. How else do you think I became the sausage king of Chicago?
And also, why would the box from South Africa not be as nice as one from ‘the states’?
Not only that, you're far more likely to use an eGate than to see a person
Yes I said and addressed that.

My brother - I am well aware NJ and Hawaii are both the same country. I was just trying to include some hopefully helpful perspective. I think that was obvious I was aware when clarifying that I didn’t go through customs and then having a separate comment specifically addressing what I’d do in their shoes. No need to try and reply back like I’m an idiot, especially when I’m just trying to be helpful to an internet stranger.

I think the reason is that the box would show they bought the ring in SA. Toss the box = toss evidence of where the ring was purchased. Then buy a new box to put the ring in for the proposal. Not an attempt to insult the quality of ring boxes from SA.
you are an idiot your comment contributes literally nothing since the anecdote is totally irrelevant
Yes. I realised that.
Americans gonna American.
I mean to an extent but this is particularly bad even for an american (which i am lol)
So am I. Lol
